instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.P5VG3S_PGOOD: What is P5VG3S_PGOOD? P5VG3S_PGOOD is a signal that indicates that the PP5V_G3S power rail is functioning properly. .
definitions.PP1V2_AWAKE: What is PP1V2_AWAKE? The PP1V2_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides 1.2 volts and is associated with the machine's awake state and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP3V_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V_G3H_RTC? PP3V_G3H_RTC is a 3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3H mechanical off state that powers the RTC circuit. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.ONOFF_L: What is ONOFF_L? This is a abbreviation of SMC_ONOFF_L.When you see ONOFF_L, assume they meant to type SMC_ONOFF_L.

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message:
hi there
these are quite new to me still, dont get them often.
So i fixed a short on ppbus, was caused by <CAPACITOR>C9074</CAPACITOR> which spontaneously died i think (liquid was not near this at all)
It's hard to find liquid on this guy, but i found some traces broken around <CHIP>U5111</CHIP> (which i think arent critical)

Anyway, i get ppbus 12.6V now
all the G3H stuff is there, i am getting <SIGNAL>P3V3MAIN_PGOOD</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_PGOOD</SIGNAL>
I cant really find the page with all the rails, but im trying my best.

I'm missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, which i think is being created by <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> if im not mistaken?
Theres a giant shield over <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> (and <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>) so am waiting to check in here first before i remove that shield and possibly ruin stuff under it.

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: Voltage and current on USB-C? Did you try to follow power sequence?

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: Do you get other voltages from <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> (SYM 1 OF 4)?

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message:
yeah sorry forgot to add the obvious: board is asking 20v and draws 0.00amps

LDOs from <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>:

<SIGNAL>LDO_CORE</SIGNAL> = 1.50V
<SIGNAL>PP0V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> = 0.8V
<SIGNAL>PP3V_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> = 3.0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_AWAKE</SIGNAL> = 1.20V
<SIGNAL>PMU_LDO3_OUT_R</SIGNAL> = 1.8V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL> = 3.29V

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: Power on sequence mentions that <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> appears after <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is triggered.

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message:
ok, i was under the assumption these would start automatically when charger is connected.
I realised there was a power diagram yesterday and indeed saw that same sequence, so tried triggering PMU-<SIGNAL>ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to ground with tweezers while measuring <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: but no response, no pulsing either.

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message:
so following the power on sequence:
I am having everything up until  <SIGNAL>SSD0_OCARINA_WP_L</SIGNAL>
Have no idea where that's from (i'm assuming PMIC here) 

<SIGNAL>SSD0_OCARINA_PFN</SIGNAL> is there at 1.8v
<SIGNAL>SSD0_OCARINA_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0.0v

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: Do you get correct level for <SIGNAL>0V9_SSD0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: yes, both are present at 0.9 and 2.5v

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message:
The board should start by itself when charger is connected; if no battery connected.
<SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is needed to turn on the board only if battery alone is connected (no charger).

Looks like T2 is not able to access dedicated partition on SSD.
Try DFU restore, just in case.

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: well i cant get this thing to do anything, cannot get it into DFU mode.
